ARABIC: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There is certainly a Sign in that, yet most of them are not muminun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In this there is, certainly, evidence (of the Truth). But most of them have no faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed in this is a sign; and most of them will not accept faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, in this is an Ayah, yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely there is a sign in that, but most of them will not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Surely in this there is a sign, yet most of them would not believe:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily therein is a sign; yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, in this is an Ayah (proof or sign), yet most of them (polytheists, pagans, etc., who do not believe in Resurrection) are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Surely, in this there is a sign yet most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:8] Surely in that there is a sign, an indication of the perfection of His power, exalted be He; but most of them, in God’s knowledge, are not believers (kāna here according to Sībawayhi is extra).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Herein) in the different kinds of fruit (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition; (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers, and all of them were disbelievers, i.e. those who perished at Badr.
